Jum Ryan

About Me

Well, hello there.

What would make a teacher/brewer/musician decide to have a go at the world of software development?

The appeal lies in utilizing facets from all of my prior careers - creativity, science, machine/control systems, and constant growth to feed an inquisitive mind. I've completed CS50's Intro to Computer Science, and am deep in The Odin Project's Javascript stream - this page provides a taste of the projects that have stemmed from those courses.

My Projects

A Shopping Cart

Here I set up (an imaginary) shop, for those with frivolous spending habits to the shopping process...without the impact on their credit card. Built with React (on Vite) utilising React Router DOM, API calls, State, Effect, and also a few CSS transitions as I'm a little rusty.

Game of Memory

A basic React app to utilise an api call to fetch a collection of images, to be used in a memory game. Or Game of Memory, if you will.

Resume Builder

My first foray into React. Providing plenty of opportunities to play with props and state. I added a 'print preview' as a bonus.

Sink The Ships!

Based on the classic game, Battleship. The culmination of TOP's Javascript course. Utilising test driven development to build the app, extended to add HTML/CSS/JS drag-and-drop functionality.

Todo List

A "todo" webapp built on Javascript, HTML, CSS - supported by localStorage and webpack libraries. Functionality includes Projects (to group tasks), filters (by date/priority), colour coding, and "task completion".

Weather App

Have you ever wondered what the weather is like outside, without having to go outside? Wonder no longer. Weather app not only tells you what it's like, but it will tell you the future. More importantly, it required being able to fetch data from an API, and display it in a pretty fashion.

A Simple Calculator

A simple calculator. It manages basic arithmetic, decimal places, keyboard control, and a max number to keep that display in check. Best of all, it's solar powered!!

Jum's Jive & Dive

This would be the swing dancing dive bar I'd open if I wasn't too busy learning to code. See also: gardening, renovations, summer job, beach time, etc. The actual purpose was to get familiar with NPM webpack's, which I now use daily.

Flex-a-sketch

An etch-a-sketch UI built from the ground up. The focus was on DOM manipulation. The result is quite fun - with rainbow functionality added as a little bonus!

Rock, Paper, Scissors

It's a classic game, played since the dawn of time. Or at least as long as I recall. It was my first introduction to event listeners, callback functions, and DOM manipulation. Clearly the goal was not a pretty UI. But it does what it should.
